dimcat.slicer package¶

Submodules¶

dimcat.slicer.base module¶

A Slicer is a PipelineStep that cuts Data into segments, effectively multiplying IDs.

class dimcat.slicer.base.ChordCriterionSlicer(column='chord', contains_str=None, warn_na=False)[source]¶

Bases: OnePassFacetSlicer

Create slices based on a particular criterion such that each True row starts a new slice.

The ‘expanded’ labels are not sliced but subselected. For the special case of phrase labels that may actually occur without a new harmony and need slice the table, use PhraseSlicer.

check(facet_df)[source]¶

Test piece of data for certain properties before computing analysis.

Returns:

  • bool – True if the passed data is eligible.

  • str – Error message in case the passed data is not eligible.

iter_slices(index, facet_df, column='chord', contains_str=None, warn_na=False)[source]¶

Slices the facet_df (e.g. notes or annotations) and iterates through the slices so that they can be stored.

Yields:

  • tuple – The DataFrame’s index with the slice’s quarterbeat interval appended. Will be used to store and look up information on this particular slice.

  • pandas.Series – Information about the slice, especially the feature value(s) based on which the segment has come about, such as the local key. Mainly used for subsequent grouping of slices.

  • pandas.DataFrame – The slice, i.e. a chunk or subselection of facet_df.

Bases: OnePassFacetSlicer

Create slices based on a particular feature by grouping adjacent identical values.

Bases: Slicer

A FacetSlicer creates slice information based on one particular data facet, e.g. note lists or annotations.

config¶

“slice_level_name”} to give the third index column that contains the slices’ intervals a meaningful name. Define {“slicer”: “slicer_name”} for the creation of meaningful file names.

abstract iter_slices(index, facet_df, **config) → Tuple[tuple, Series][source]¶

Generates slice intervals and slice_info Series based on facet_df (e.g. notes or annotations) and iterates through them so that they can be stored and then used for slicing the facet.

Yields:

  • tuple – The DataFrame’s index with the slice’s quarterbeat interval appended. Will be used to store and look up information on this particular slice.

  • pandas.Series – Information about the slice, especially the feature value(s) based on which the segment has come about, such as the local key. Mainly used for subsequent grouping of slices.

class dimcat.slicer.base.LazyFacetSlicer(facet, slice_name, **config)[source]¶

Bases: FacetSlicer

A FacetSlicer creates slice information based on one particular data facet, e.g. note lists or annotations.

It is called ‘lazy’ because it does not perform any actual slicing, which will be up to the Data object to do upon request.

class dimcat.slicer.base.OnePassFacetSlicer(facet, slice_name, **config)[source]¶

Bases: FacetSlicer

These slicers use information already available based on the computation of slice intervals and slice_info. Either this computation has left them with chunks already, or the facet does not actually have to be sliced because chunks can be created by subselecting it with the computed intervals.

abstract iter_slices(index, facet_df, **config) → Tuple[tuple, Series, DataFrame][source]¶

  • pandas.Series – Information about the slice, especially the feature value(s) based on which the segment has come about, such as the local key. Mainly used for subsequent grouping of slices.

  • pandas.DataFrame – The slice, i.e. a chunk or subselection of facet_df.

SPLIT_REGEX = re.compile('\n                            ^(?P<label>\\.?\n                                (?:[a-gA-G](?:b*|\\#*)\\.)?\n                                (?:(?:(?:b*|\\#*)(?:VII|VI|V|IV|III|II|I|vii|vi|v|iv|iii|ii, re.VERBOSE)¶

iter_slices(index, facet_df, warn_na=False)[source]¶

Generates slice intervals and slice_info Series based on facet_df (e.g. notes or annotations) and iterates through them so that they can be stored and then used for slicing the facet.

Yields:

  • tuple – The DataFrame’s index with the slice’s quarterbeat interval appended. Will be used to store and look up information on this particular slice.

  • pandas.Series – Information about the slice, especially the feature value(s) based on which the segment has come about, such as the local key. Mainly used for subsequent grouping of slices.

perform_facet_slicing(data: Data) → Data[source]¶

This is where the special slicing takes place.

class dimcat.slicer.base.Slicer[source]¶

Bases: PipelineStep, ABC

A Slicer will process a Data object by extracting chunks of rows based on an IntervalIndex, which may potentially result in data points to be duplicated or split in two.

Concretely, it iterates through index groups and, for each Interval to form a slice of a particular piece, creates a new index tuple with the Interval appended.

If created from a facet, the slicer creates a pandas.Series per slice containing metadata for later grouping, and stores it in data.slice_info[(corpus, fname, Interval)]. The slices generated from this can be found in data.sliced[facet][(corpus, fname, Interval)].

class dimcat.slicer.base.SpecialFacetSlicer(facet, slice_name, **config)[source]¶

Bases: LazyFacetSlicer

These facet slicers first gather slice intervals and info and then perform an individual kind of slicing afterwards.

abstract perform_facet_slicing(data: Data) → Data[source]¶

This is where the special slicing takes place.
